meanings.sent1: The chromogenic flowers brightened up the garden.
meanings.sent2: The artist used chromogenic paints to create a vibrant masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The chromogenic crayons made the drawing look like a rainbow.
meanings.sent4: Her chromogenic personality added a splash of excitement to the party.
meanings.sent5: The chromogenic sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: Relating to or involving the production of color
meanings.sent1: The chromogenic light bulbs illuminated the room with a warm glow.
meanings.sent2: The chromogenic film captured the essence of the colorful festival.
meanings.sent3: The chromogenic decorations made the event feel like a rainbow wonderland.
meanings.sent4: Her chromogenic outfit was a burst of color in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The chromogenic artwork brought life to the dull walls of the gallery.

meanings.sent1: The chromogenic ink in the printer created vivid prints.
meanings.sent2: The chromogenic chemicals reacted to form a spectrum of colors.
meanings.sent3: The chromogenic markers turned the plain paper into a colorful canvas.
meanings.sent4: His chromogenic imagination painted fantastical worlds in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The chromogenic fabric dyed in rich hues caught everyone's attention.
